title: Initialize Objects
description: Create a Book class with proper initialization
starterCode:
# Create a Book class with title, author, and pages attributes
# Add a method get_info() that returns book information

# Your code here

# Test
book = Book("Python OOP", "John Doe", 250)
print(book.get_info())
solution:
# Book class with proper initialization
class Book:
    def __init__(self, title, author, pages):
        self.title = title
        self.author = author
        self.pages = pages
    
    def get_info(self):
        return f"{self.title} by {self.author}, {self.pages} pages"

# Test
book = Book("Python OOP", "John Doe", 250)
print(book.get_info())
hints: __init__ is called when object is created
Store parameters as instance attributes using self

testCases.expectedOutput: Python OOP by John Doe, 250 pages
